guide_overview.title: Support and Resistance - Identification and Application
guide_overview.introduction: By now you should know what support and resistance mean. Now it's about identifying these price areas in the market and applying them correctly. We will cover the following points.

identification_methods.description: They should mark significant highs or lows, such as the impulse high/low or the correction high/low of a trend movement.
application_areas: Marking impulse highs/lows and correction highs/lows of a trend movement
Marking psychological price levels (e.g., 100 Euros) as these are also recognized as support and resistance
In intraday trading: marking the opening price of the respective trading day, as this also acts as support and resistance

identification_methods.description: They connect higher highs/lows and lower lows/highs and, with their angle of inclination, provide information about the strength of a trend.
drawing_methods: From candle body to candle body
key_principles: When a trendline is approached again, support or resistance is naturally expected.
The more touchpoints a trendline has, the higher its significance.

correct_application.title: Correct Application of Support and Resistance
correct_application.core_principle: As with all other types of technical analysis, a standalone support or resistance area should not be blindly used as an entry, but should always be combined with other analysis tools! More on this in the #4-zones channel.
correct_application.significance_rule: Similar to trendlines, the rule applies: the more often a support or resistance has already held, the more significant this price area is.
correct_application.definition_of_holding: Such a price area is considered as holding if it was not broken by a candle's closing price (support not closed below, resistance not closed above).
correct_application.definition_of_break: Conversely, such an area is considered broken if it is closed below (support) or above (resistance) by a candle's closing price.
correct_application.recognition_signals: If we see a rejection in the form of wicks or shadows at the price area, this is a first sign that this price is recognized by the market and that the support or resistance might hold.
correct_application.polarity_principle: For all types of support/resistance, the principle of changing polarity applies, which we explained in the #0-introduction channel.

key_takeaways: Support and resistance are dynamic concepts that require proper identification and contextual application.
Multiple methods (horizontal lines, trendlines, Fibonacci) should be used in conjunction for higher probability setups.
The strength of a level increases with the number of times price has respected it.
Always confirm with price action (rejections, closes beyond levels) before making trading decisions.
Polarity shifts (support becomes resistance, resistance becomes support) are a fundamental market behavior.
